column1: #Text=Pikelets are a type of griddlecake that are popular in Australia , the United Kingdom , and New Zealand .
#Text=They 're similar to both pancakes and crumpets , and make a delicious dish for breakfast , brunch , and buffets .
#Text=Pikelets are typically smaller than pancakes and sweeter than crumpets , so they make a tasty treat for kids and adults alike , and are also great for tea time .
#Text=Making pikelets is similar to making pancakes and other griddlecakes .
#Text=Along with your ingredients and toppings of choice , you 'll also need :
#Text=Sift the flour , baking powder , and salt into a medium bowl .
#Text=Pour in the sugar , and whisk all the ingredients together to remove lumps and combine everything .
#Text=If you do n’t have a sifter , simply combine all the ingredients in a bowl and whisk them together .
#Text=Crack the egg into the small bowl and beat it for a minute with the whisk .
#Text=Pour in the milk and whisk the two ingredients together for a minute until they 're fully combined .
#Text=It ’s important to crack the egg first into an empty bowl , because that way you can easily remove any shell pieces that fall in .
#Text=Use your hand or a spoon to make a well in the center of the flour mixture .
#Text=Pour the egg and milk mixture into the well .
#Text=Whisk all the ingredients together until they 're just combined and form a smooth , thick batter .
#Text=Do n’t overmix the batter , as this will develop the gluten in the flour .
#Text=Making a well in the center of the flour mixture will help you incorporate all the ingredients faster without having to overmix .
#Text=Pikelet batter should be thick , but not so thick that it wo n’t drop off the end of a spoon .
#Text=If the batter is n't runny enough to do that , add milk in tablespoonfuls ( 15-ml increments ) until you achieve the right consistency .
#Text=Place your griddle or frying pan over medium heat and allow it to warm up .
#Text=If you 're not using a non-stick pan , add a tablespoon ( 15 ml ) of cooking oil to the pan as well .
#Text=When the oil is warm , pick up the pan and swirl the oil around to coat the pan .
#Text=You can use butter to cook the pikelets , but butter has a much lower smoke point than oil , and even medium heat will be enough to burn it .
#Text=Pikelets are traditionally quite small , and each one only requires a tablespoon ( 15 ml ) of batter .
#Text=Drop one tablespoonful of batter into the hot pan for each pikelet , leaving room between them for expansion .
#Text=Cook the pikelets for about a minute , until bubbles begin to form and pop in the surface of the batter .
#Text=When that happens , flip them over and cook for another minute or so , until both sides are golden brown .
#Text=Remove the cooked pikelets from the pan and transfer them to a plate .
#Text=Cover them with a clean tea towel so they stay warm while you cook the remaining batches .
#Text=Continue cooking the pikelets until all the batter is gone .
#Text=Like pancakes and crumpets , pikelets can be eaten plain , or topped with a variety of ingredients .
#Text=Butter is a classic topping for pikelets , and you can combine it with other toppings as well .
#Text=When the pikelets are still warm , spread a thin layer of butter over each one .
#Text=You can also stack a few pikelets on top of each other , and then place a dollop of butter on top of the stack .
#Text=There are many ways that you can use fruit to garnish pikelets .
#Text=You can serve them with fresh fruit cut into bite-sized pieces , you can top them with jam , or you can make your own fruit puree and drizzle that on top .
#Text=Great fruit to pair with pikelets includes strawberries , blueberries , and bananas .
#Text=Crumpets are traditionally served with salted butter and jam , and you can serve pikelets the same way .
#Text=Butter is n't the only option for spreading on pikelets , and there are many dairy products you can use to garnish these little griddlecakes , including :
#Text=For people who prefer their pikelets a little lighter , you can also serve them with sweet syrups , such as honey , corn syrup , maple syrup , birch syrup , or chocolate sauce .
#Text=Make a stack of two or three pikelets on a plate .
#Text=Top with a bit of butter , and then drizzle the entire stack with the syrup or sauce of your choice .
